Topic.Title: You got to hand it to old Mr. Slick

Message.Msg: ...“Well Frogg, I heard Axelrod just the morning say the decision to delay had nothing to do with the up coming (sic) midterm election. So, there you have it. The truth and nothing but the truth.” – t.bfine Typical...much ado about nothing. Hey, boys, your own Chamber of Commerce and The National Retail Federation seems to disagree with you...obviously you and frogboy seem to think you know more about business than they do, because they called it ”the right and wise approach”. It seems you really don’t care what the subject is, but if it comes from this Administration, it’s gotta’ be bad. How pathetically un-American. “Business groups including the U.S. Chamber of Commerce -- which largely opposed the health care law called the Affordable Care Act, or ACA -- have long sought a delay in the rules requiring them to report on their employees' health coverage and to pay penalties. ‘They're not ready, we're not ready, and rather than plow ahead, they're going to take the right and wise approach,’ said Neil Trautwein, employee benefits policy counsel for the National Retail Federation. ‘The last thing the administration or the business community needs is for the ACA to come out of the gate sideways.’ – Huff Post Business, 7/2

Topic.Title: You got to hand it to old Mr. Slick

Message.Msg: Obviously you were unable to comprehend my previous post, so I will try again: If you actually read my last post, you would have read that I actually praised our "dear leader" for postponing the 2014 implementation activities until 2015. Further I applauded his political aplomb for recognizing the political ramifications that would result from the 2014 implementation. As for the U.S. Chamber of Commerce and the National Retail Federation their positions and words are well founded and have merit. As far as my comments regarding the Republican leadership I stand by those words and still maintain that they feckless and sorely wanting in their abilities to play in the "Big Boy" arena with the current occupier of 1600 Pennsylvania Ave. As far as your comment: Typical...much ado about nothing. ... Really! Really! You indicate much ado about nothing even after you include the comments from the U.S. Chamber of Commerce and the National Retail Federation. Sometimes I don't think you read your own posts. "In your heart you know he is right." The Frogg

Topic.Title: Obamacare to hit low income earners the hardest

Message.Msg: I had Kaiser-Permanente from 1971 til last year. Never had an increase in my co-pays. I'm sure my company and later SS did get increases on the primary premium. I'm in Arizona and have another insurer. Just got notification of a 20% increase in my premium Plus, I pay a large deductible until I pay a certain amount each year. I and my family got excellent care through Kaiser all those years. Health insurers get in bed with state pols and pass laws that make it almost impossible for HMO's like Kaiser to come into their states. I think it was probably the insurers behind Obama Care. "Our?" representatives voted on a bill they knew nothing about. A criminal act as far as I'm concerned.

Topic.Title: What`s so important about Snowden? Nothing?

Message.Msg: "if he shares any further secrets" This directly from the State Department Page "Passport Information for Criminal Law Enforcement Officers", "Denial or revocation of a passport does not prevent the use of outstanding valid passports. . . The physical revocation of a passport is often difficult, and an apparently valid passport can be used for travel until officially taken by an arresting officer or by a court." Snowden is being held captive by Russia, by Russia's own initiative or by US request. Of course the US is requesting extradition so I think you can assume whatever is on his laptop is already shared. I'm sure China got what they wanted too. Snowden is not a diplomat and does not have the protection of his government or international law. I have no idea what he was thinking. He is a traitor and a dumb one at that. If you're upset about government surveillance you don't go to China or Russia, for crying out loud.
